instNote: ﻿On Sunday, besides the high Mass at 10 o'clock, at which there is an English and a French sermon alternately, there is Mass and a sermon in the German language at 9 o'clock. After Vespers, there is a meeting of the Confraternity of the Rosary.

NOTES: ﻿https://icnewmadrid.com/church-history ; 1833 almanac mentions no name for the church, but the 1860s/70s almanacs mention a St. John. The church site says that said church(es) came after the war. This means that this one in the 1833 almanac is likely the precursor.

NOTES: ﻿Source says the present church was built in 1860, but it stands to reason that if the record goes back this far, another structure stood here before the one still standing. Same name, same location: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Paul_Catholic_Church_(Center,_Missouri)
